extendedIngredients.name: cilantro leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: poblano peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 to 9 poblano peppers, roasted, peeled and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: serrano peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: Jalapeno or serrano peppers if needed for spice (poblanos will vary in their heat)
metaInformation: for spice (poblanos will vary in their heat)

extendedIngredients.name: tomatillos
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 to 15 tomatillos, washed, paper-like skins removed

recipes.title: Sharsh's White Bean Chicken Chili

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken Chili works really well with Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. One wine you could try is Segura Viudas Brut Reserva Heredad Cava. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 22 dollars.

productMatches.title: Segura Viudas Brut Reserva Heredad Cava
productMatches.description: Like a rich Chardonnay with bubbles, this limited production Cava rests on an authentic pewter base and comes in a handsome hand-blown bottle emblazoned with a metal crest of the Segura Viudas family. Perfect with pasta drizzled in truffle oil, slow braised meats, cured meat and cheese plates, oysters.

recipes.instructions: Roast the poblano peppers on a grill or under the broiler turning often, until blackened and soft. Place them in a bowl covered with plastic wrap to cool (this will make peeling them easier). When cool; peel, seed and dice the poblano peppers.                          Dice the onions and bell pepper. Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven or kettle. Add onions, yellow bell pepper, poblano peppers, pressed garlic, chili powder and ancho chili powder. Saute this mixture until the onions are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the diced chicken breast and continue to cook until chicken is fully cooked, 10 to 15 minutes depending on the size of your dice.                          Wash and stem the tomatillos then run them through a food processor until they are pulverized, but still have some texture (you could dice them by hand, but this will leave the tomatillo skins floating around in your finished product). Add the tomatillos and the broth to the chicken and pepper mixture. After this is heated through (about 10 minutes), check the spiciness and, if necessary, add either a finely chopped jalapeno or serrano pepper for more heat (we're looking for a slow, sustained burn, not fire). Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes to meld the flavors. Add the beans and cilantro, cook a final 5 minutes to heat thoroughly and serve with a garnish of cilantro and lime slice.

steps.step: Roast the poblano peppers on a grill or under the broiler turning often, until blackened and soft.
Place them in a bowl covered with plastic wrap to cool (this will make peeling them easier). When cool; peel, seed and dice the poblano peppers.
Dice the onions and bell pepper.
Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven or kettle.
Add onions, yellow bell pepper, poblano peppers, pressed garlic, chili powder and ancho chili powder.
Saute this mixture until the onions are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the diced chicken breast and continue to cook until chicken is fully cooked, 10 to 15 minutes depending on the size of your dice.

Wash and stem the tomatillos then run them through a food processor until they are pulverized, but still have some texture (you could dice them by hand, but this will leave the tomatillo skins floating around in your finished product).

Add the tomatillos and the broth to the chicken and pepper mixture. After this is heated through (about 10 minutes), check the spiciness and, if necessary, add either a finely chopped jalapeno or serrano pepper for more heat (we're looking for a slow, sustained burn, not fire). Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes to meld the flavors.
Add the beans and cilantro, cook a final 5 minutes to heat thoroughly and serve with a garnish of cilantro and lime slice.
